title: EU concerned over delay in PTA repeal
byline: The European Union (EU) GSP+ monitoring mission, which is currently in town, has once again expressed concern over the delay in repealing the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA), despite a promise made as far back as 2017, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Rs.4.5 Mn worth of jewelry and valuables stolen from Swiss Ambassador’s residence
byline: A stock of gold jewelry, including a diamond-studded ring and luxury wristwatches, with a total value of approximately Rs. 4.5 million, has been stolen from a safe at the official residence of the Swiss Ambassador in Sri Lanka, police said.

title: India-Pakistan tensions could raise costs for SriLankan Airlines, threaten Colombo Port’s transshipment revenue- Asha Securities Research
byline: The escalating military tensions between India and Pakistan are casting a shadow over Sri Lanka’s aviation and maritime sectors, with SriLankan Airlines facing higher operational costs and the Port of Colombo risking lost transshipment revenue, according to an analysis by Asha Securities Research.

title: IMF seeks Govt to fast-track restructuring SriLankan Airlines
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) emphasised the need to fast-track the process of restructuring SriLankan Airlines, and to see more progress related to other state owned enterprises (SOEs).

title: Colombo consumer prices decline 2.0% in April
byline: The consumer prices in the Colombo district fell by another 2.0 percent in the 12 months to April 2025, albeit at a slower pace from 2.6 percent seen through March.

title: RW, UNP ready to back any positive move to resolve US para tariff crisis: Ruwan
byline: Both former President Ranil Wickremesinghe and the United National Party (UNP) are ready to back any positive moves taken by Sri Lankan authorities to resolve the US para tariff crisis, UNP Deputy Leader Ruwan Wijewardene said today.

title: Debit, credit card payments on expressways delayed
byline: The payment system for debit and credit cards on expressways, which was scheduled to be implemented from today, will be further delayed, the Road Development Authority (RDA) said.

title: NPP focused on developing nation experiencing extensive economic, social, political transformation: Prez
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP), responding to the people’s aspirations, is currently focused on developing a nation that is experiencing extensive economic, social and political transformation,President Anura Kumara Disanayake said.

title: Train derails near Colombo Fort station
byline: The ‘Pulathisi’ Intercity Express train, which was travelling from Batticaloa to Colombo Fort, derailed near the Colombo Fort Railway Station this morning, the Railways Department said.

title: Bus fares to remain unchanged: Gemunu
byline: Even though the price of diesel has decreased by Rs. 12, there will be no revision of bus fares, Lanka Private Bus Owners’ Association (LPBOA) Chairman Gemunu Wijeratne said.

title: Rise in childhood asthma cases sparks health alert
byline: Health experts in Sri Lanka have sounded the alarm over a noticeable rise in asthma cases among children, Chest Physician Dr. Asha Samaranayaka said.

title: No chance for Opposition without real change: Harini
byline: The people of this country will not give the Opposition a chance unless they change their practices, philosophy and behaviour even if they form independent groups and contest under different symbols, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said.

title: Man hacked with an axe in Lunugamwehera
byline: A 67-year-old man died after being hacked with an axe last night in the Lunugamwehera police area, police said.

title: Three-wheeler fares unchanged despite fuel price cut: Three-Wheeler Drivers’ Union
byline: Following the recent reduction in the price of a litre of 92 Octane petrol, the All-Island Three-Wheeler Drivers’ Union (AITWDU) said they are unable to reduce three-wheeler taxi fares at this time, as the decision must be made by the Western Province National Transport Commission and the National Transport Commission (NTC).

title: Will submit report on repealing PTA in Parliament within three months: Govt. assures EU mission
byline: The government has informed the European Union (EU) GSP+ monitoring mission that the committee appointed on the repeal of the PTA will submit its report in Parliament within three months.

title: Fuel prices slashed
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has announced a fuel price reduction, effective from midnight today.

title: Board of inquiry appointed to probe sudden death of Sabaragamuwa University student
byline: A board of inquiry was appointed to conduct a comprehensive investigation into the sudden death of a second year student attached to the Faculty of Technology at the Sabaragamuwa University, the Ministry of Higher Education said.
